sentences: Kes iseendasse usub, seda teisedki usuvad.
context: Uskuma is an Estonian verb that primarily means 'to believe' or 'to have faith in something.' It can refer to religious belief (believing in God), confidence in something or someone, or acceptance of information as true. The word belongs to a group of verbs with sk-s gradation and has various conjugated forms including usun (I believe), usub (he/she/it believes), and usuvad (they believe). It can be used both actively (someone believing) and passively (something being believed).
